definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: The film is a piece of schlock.
sentences.chinese: 這是一部粗製濫造的電影片子。

sentences.english: Some TV plays are made in a rough and slipshod way.
sentences.chinese: 有些電視劇是粗製濫造的。

sentences.english: He has been churning out detective stories for more than ten years.
sentences.chinese: 十多年來，他一直在大量粗製濫造偵探小說。

sentences.english: By the late 19th century a local factory churned out violins.
sentences.chinese: 19世紀末，當地一家工廠粗製濫造出大量小提琴。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
